posts.author: WhiZard
posts.content:
Purple Singing Arrow (Bard 8/Purple Dragon Knight 3/Arcane Archer 9)
Note: This build uses a feature that some servers might consider an exploit and may nerf. The PDK fear has a 255 DC (reported as 127) if the strength modifier is negative. Additionally, PDK fear ignores spell resistance and spell immunity because it is cast as a feat. This build achieves the PDK fear (with immunity from the bard spell clarity) at level 9.
Elf, True Neutral or Neutral Good
PvM/PvP (1-20)

STR: 9
DEX: 18 (22)
CON: 13 (14)
WIS: 8
INT: 14
CHA: 13

Hitpoints: 190 (max) 157 (average)
Skillpoints: 132
Saving Throws (Fortitude/Reflex/Will): 13/19/9
Saving Throw bonuses: +5 vs. spells, +2 vs. mind-affecting
BAB: 18
AB: +30/+25/+20/+15 (mundane bow), +28/ +23/ +18/ +13 (mounted with mundane bow)
AB, melee: +17/+12/+7/+2 (w/o finesse)
Damage: 1d8 +4 (normal arrows penetrate +5 DR automatically)
AC: 20 (naked), 23-27 (naked and mounted)

PDK Fear DC: 255

*As the penalties mounted archery reduces can be removed by lesser restoration, this feat may be unnecessary if this exploit is not removed. In that case a substitution of weapon finesse or toughness may help.

Pros: DR penetration, decent spell casting even when in combat, many good buffs (inspire courage, bard song). If neutral good, you can use magic circle against alignment to shield allies before you cast the PDK fear; if true neutral, your PDK fear will need clarity to block (making it more potent).

Cons: Feat starved and skills have delayed progression. Low levels may be tougher.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Even without the exploit this is a good build!
The horse-archer was a feared weapon in it's time.
In NWN riding a horse gives a 50 % speed bonus and offers another way of playing the classical speed-archer tactics.

posts.author: WhiZard
posts.content:
Mick Dagger wrote:
In NWN riding a horse gives a 50 % speed bonus and offers another way of playing the classical speed-archer tactics.
Actually the speed is slightly higher. The mounted appearance moves at the "fast" movement speed instead of "PC" speed. Fast is 9/8 the PC speed. So in total the increase would be 68.75%.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Aye, the horses indeed move a little faster than simple haste, and good build btw Whizard, my only suggestion would be to change your attributes to STR 8 & CHA 14 perhaps.

posts.content:
